data.name: Standard Deviation of a column
data.description:
Get the sample standard deviation of a column

Lot's of times when examining a new data set, you just want to generate some quick summary statistics. Write a function that takes the name of a column and returns the standard deviation of that column, rounded to the nearest two digits.

We will use the iris dataset, which is automatically loaded into your environment as a data frame named "iris". You can learn more about the iris dataset here: https://archive.ics.uci.edu/dataset/53/iris. The data frame has 5 columns: "Sepal.Length", "Sepal.Width", "Petal.Length", "Petal.Width", "Species"

To learn more about the difference between sample and populaiton standard deviation: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Standard_deviation
